spinehx.atlas.TextureRegion

type
class
subclasses
spinehx.atlas.AtlasRegion

Static Methods

copy(region : TextureRegion) : TextureRegion

Constructs a region with the same texture and coordinates of the specified region.

createRelXYWH(region : TextureRegion, x : Int, y : Int, width : Int, height : Int) : TextureRegion

parameters
width The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
height The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
Constructs a region with the same texture as the specified region and sets the coordinates relative to the specified region.

fromTexture(texture : Texture) : TextureRegion

Constructs a region the size of the specified texture.

fromTextureUVUV(texture : Texture, u : Float, v : Float, u2 : Float, v2 : Float) : TextureRegion

fromTextureWH(texture : Texture, width : Int, height : Int) : TextureRegion

parameters
width The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
height The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.

fromTextureXYWH(texture : Texture, x : Int, y : Int, width : Int, height : Int) : TextureRegion

parameters
width The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
height The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.

splitTex(texture : Texture, tileWidth : Int, tileHeight : Int) : Array<Array<TextureRegion>>

parameters
texture the Texture
tileWidth a tile's width in pixels
tileHeight a tile's height in pixels
returns
a 2D array of TextureRegions indexed by [row][column].
Helper function to create tiles out of the given {@link Texture} starting from the top left corner going to the left and ending at the bottom right corner. Only complete tiles will be returned so if the texture's width or height are not a multiple of the tile width and height not all of the texture will be used.

Constructor

new()
Constructs a region with no texture and no coordinates defined.

regionHeight : Int

regionWidth : Int

texture : Texture

u : Float

u2 : Float

v : Float

v2 : Float

Instance Methods

flip(x : Bool, y : Bool) : Void

getRegionHeight() : Int

Returns the region's height.

getRegionWidth() : Int

Returns the region's width.

getRegionX() : Int

getRegionY() : Int

getTexture() : Texture

getU() : Float

getU2() : Float

getV() : Float

getV2() : Float

isFlipX() : Bool

isFlipY() : Bool

scroll(xAmount : Float, yAmount : Float) : Void

parameters
xAmount The percentage to offset horizontally.
yAmount The percentage to offset vertically. This is done in texture space, so up is negative.
Offsets the region relative to the current region. Generally the region's size should be the entire size of the texture in the direction(s) it is scrolled.

setRegionCopy(region : TextureRegion) : Void

Sets the texture and coordinates to the specified region.

setRegionHeight(height : Int) : Void

setRegionRelXYWH(region : TextureRegion, x : Int, y : Int, width : Int, height : Int) : Void

Sets the texture to that of the specified region and sets the coordinates relative to the specified region.

setRegionTex(texture : Texture) : Void

Sets the texture and sets the coordinates to the size of the specified texture.

setRegionUV(u : Float, v : Float, u2 : Float, v2 : Float) : Void

setRegionWidth(width : Int) : Void

setRegionX(x : Int) : Void

setRegionXYWH(x : Int, y : Int, width : Int, height : Int) : Void

parameters
width The width of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.
height The height of the texture region. May be negative to flip the sprite when drawn.

setRegionY(y : Int) : Void

setTexture(texture : Texture) : Void

setU(u : Float) : Void

setU2(u2 : Float) : Void

setV(v : Float) : Void

setV2(v2 : Float) : Void

split(tileWidth : Int, tileHeight : Int) : Array<Array<TextureRegion>>

parameters
tileWidth a tile's width in pixels
tileHeight a tile's height in pixels
returns
a 2D array of TextureRegions indexed by [row][column].
Helper function to create tiles out of this TextureRegion starting from the top left corner going to the left and ending at the bottom right corner. Only complete tiles will be returned so if the region's width or height are not a multiple of the tile width and height not all of the region will be used.
